channel.title: AWS on Christopher Nadeau
channel.description: Recent content in AWS on Christopher Nadeau

item.title: AWS VPC Network Structure
item.description: I recently started playing around with AWS. One of the really cool things about AWS is the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) features. By creating a VPC, you create a private network for yourself complete with NAT gateways, custom route tables, firewalls and more. VPC Components A VPC is made up of several main components: CIDR Block When you create your VPC, you are asked to define a CIDR block, which is the range of IP addresses you want your VPC to use.
